banner._title: A New Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System
desc: The MarcoPolo Protocol (MAP) is a new peer-to-peer electronic cash system infrastructure that is strategically invested by Softbank. It aims to achieve public chain TPS sharing and intelligent scheduling through multiple public chains and enable the peer-to-peer cash system to enjoy the unlimited expansions of TPS and optimal GAS fee among the entire blockchain network.

chainInfo.title: Inter-Chain Sharing
desc: Interact with other public chains through BRPC protocol, realize TPS sharing and transaction scheduling among multiple public chains.

chainInfo.title: High  Scalability
desc: Communicate with multiple SynerChain and StandardChain through MTP protocol, and realize transactions.

chainInfo.title: Decentralization
desc: Adopt APoS consensus mechanism that allows participation of extra-chain assets and makes the system more decentralized and secure.

chainInfo.title: Simple Framework
desc: Build required blockchain based on the MATE framework with high speed and develop required functional modules with Delta language.

chainInfo.title: On-chain Governance
desc: Based on the SMART system, MarcoPolo can achieve self-adaptively upgrades without fork.

chainInfo.title: Never Fork
desc: A completely open on-chain governance system and incentive mechanism, driven by community incentive and promote the development of MarcoPolo.
